hackathon-description-text: HackXR is UC San Diego's FIRST EVER Virtual, Augmented, and Mixed Reality Hackathon. Hosted by the
hackathon-eligibility: Any university student can register, though travel reimbursement is not being provided at this time.
hackathon-requirements: Any VR/MR/AR project created during the 36-hour event is eligible for submission.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: FPV VR Drones and Merge VR Headsets for each team member.
$500 for the team that creates a winning multiplayer XR project
1x Windows MR headset for the team that creates a winning XR project with applications in the medical field, provided by the Qualcomm Institute.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How original was your project? Was the concept something you've never seen before or was it similar to existing projects?

How did your project take advantage of XR in a way that would be impossible in another medium?

How intuitive was it to learn? Does it cause motion sickness?

Judges will be trying all experiences; it's impossible to gauge an XR project without doing so!
How much effort did you put into your project and how difficult was it to achieve? This isn't necessarily related to skill level, we'll notice if a beginner team is going all out.
Does your project have a wow factor? This is a personal score for each judge that depends on your team's pitch, demo experience, and questions afterward.
